statement: B. Views Mattertime limit per test2 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputYou came to the exhibition and one exhibit has drawn your attention. You have $n$ stacks of blocks. The $i$-th stack has $a_i$ blocks. The maximum height of any stack is $m$. There are two cameras: one looking down from the ceiling and one looking at the side. 

Find the maximum number of blocks you can remove so that both cameras still see the same arrangement of blocks. You can only remove blocks, not move them. 

Input:

* The first line contains two integers $n$ and $m$.
* The second line contains $n$ integers $a_1, a_2, ..., a_n$.

Output:

* The maximum number of blocks you can remove.

You have several stacks of blocks.  Each stack has a certain number of blocks.  You can remove some blocks from the stacks, but the top view and side view of the remaining blocks must look the same. Find the maximum number of blocks you can remove.
